# Information bias

- Exposure identification bias 
  - recall bias, bias due to inaccurate recall of past exposure 
  - solution includes verification of responses, objective markers, well-defined cohort data
    - example given by the exposure recall made by parents of children with rare diseases 
  - interviewer bias
    - due to interaction between observer and respondents; respondents are prompted to give the responses desired by the interviewer 
  - differential vs non-differential (key is whether the misclassification extent differs between exposed vs non-exposed group)
